intro: Turnera hindsiana subsp. hindsiana, commonly known as the Hinds' turnera, is a species of flowering plant in the family Melastomataceae. It is native to Central America and parts of the Caribbean, where it typically grows in moist, shaded environments. The plant is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves and clusters of small, yellowish-white flowers. It produces capsule fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. This species is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its attractive foliage and unique floral display.
